cves.description: Vulnerability in the Oracle Configurator product of Oracle E-Business Suite (component: Runtime UI).  Supported versions that are affected are 12.2.3-12.2.14. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via HTTP to compromise Oracle Configurator.  Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in  unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to all Oracle Configurator accessible data. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 7.5 (Confidentiality impacts).  CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N).
problemType: Easily exploitable vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via HTTP to compromise Oracle Configurator.  Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in  unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to all Oracle Configurator accessible data.

cves.description: HCL Unica Centralized Offer Management is vulnerable to Insecure Direct Object References (IDOR).  An attacker can bypass authorization and access resources in the system directly, for example database records or files.
problemType: CWE-639 Authorization Bypass Through User-Controlled Key

cves.description: HCL Unica Centralized Offer Management is vulnerable to poor unhandled exceptions which exposes sensitive information.  An attacker can exploit use this information to exploit known vulnerabilities launch targeted attacks, such as remote code execution or denial of service.
problemType: CWE-703 Improper Check or Handling of Exceptional Conditions
CWE-209 Generation of Error Message Containing Sensitive Information

cves.description: HCL Unica Centralized Offer Management is vulnerable to a potential Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF). An attacker can exploit improper input validation by submitting maliciously crafted input to a target application running on a server.
